result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven James Pagenkopf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $500.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Defendant to complete an Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. The Court understands that current treatment already undertaken will continue.  Defendant to comply with any other counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: No Good Time Credit.  Huber Privileges granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Motion to Expel from Waushara County TAD Program

15CF-58 and 14CM-460 - Both Cases Called @ 11:10 AM: Defendant Steven James Pagenkopf in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Joint recommendation with argued as to cond'l jail recommendation.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  15CF-58:   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Meds/Treatment serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  14CM-460:  Def agrees and acknowledges a material violation occurred as to PPDA.  15CF-58:  Court accepts State's Motion to Amend as to Ct 1 to Illegal Poss of RX contrary to s. 450.11(7)(h) Plea:  NC.  Ct 2 (BJump):  NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Def agrees there was not a valid RX as to Ct 1.  Court affirms JOC entered as to Ct 1 (Amendment to the benefit of Def and 2 as to 15CF-58.  14CM-460:  Finds material breach occurred and agreement vacated - JOC of guilty entered.  Argument by DA as to conditional time being imposed as to Ct 1.  Argument by Atty Seifert.  Statement by Def.  Future endeavors explained to the Court.   The Court:  Accepts resolution as to all 3 charges - S/W - 2 yrs probation ordered.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Complete Anger Mgmnt Program - continue with current treatment already undertaken; Any other counseling as deemed appropriate by Supervising Agent.  Court Costs - DNA Sample to be provided and Surcharge ordered.  Expungement ability on DNA explained to Defendant.  As to Conditional WCJ as to Ct 1 only:  20 days WCJ - 6 days TS credit - approx 2 weeks left to serve.  Huber Privileges granted - No GT credit.  Report:  7/4/15 @ 8:00 PM.  Appeal Rights Given.   Atty Seifert argues for expungement due to Def's age.  State would object to any future expungement.  Further argument by Atty Seifert.  The Court:  Was not prepared to address expungement today.  However, condition of probation added for Def to successfully complete TAD Court Program - believes Def is a strong candidate.  If successful will call for expungement.  Referral process to be undertaken.  If completed the opportunity will be afforded to expungement both convictions as to 15CF-58.  If not accepted into the program, expungement opportunity will not be granted.

14CM-460 and 15CF-58 Both Cases Called @ 11:17 AM: Defendant Steven James Pagenkopf in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per Atty Seifert:  Pre-Lim to be waived today and matter to proceed to ARGN.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.   Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Special appearance noted.  NGP received and entered to Ct Nos 1 and 2 of INFO.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  14CM-460 to continue to track along.  Court sees potential candidate for TAD referral.  Status conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
From Defendant to court regarding bond reduction

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

1:05 pm case called. Defendant Steven James Pagenkopf in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Steven James Pagenkopf in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated-Confirm receipt-reading waived. Bond recommendations made.   Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Attorney Szilagyi states matter will be sent out for appointment of counsel. Statement by Attorney Anderson regarding revocation of PPDA. Court directs motion hearing be set with initial appearance on this matter.
  Initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 11:15 am.
